result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M Healy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy and notify Agent of any new or changing prescriptions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 6/15/18 to indicate defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
***Amended 12/3/18 to reflect 461 days credit.  See below.
